summary: The 'Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act' amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to extend public safety officer death benefits to Transportation Security Administration (TSA) employees who die while performing their official duties related to protecting the nation's transportation systems. This includes injuries sustained on or after October 31, 2013. The bill aims to provide support to the families of TSA employees who lose their lives in the line of duty.
